answerText: stack (accept stack overflow error)[10] Computing the Fibonacci numbers recursively can be sped up with this technique, wherein a function "remembers" the results of a past call with the same inputs, sparing some repeated computation.

question: Question:  [10] A na√Øve recursive computation of the Fibonacci numbers might result in this kind of overflow, where the namesake structure's pointer exceeds its bound. This last-in, first-out data structure uses push and pop operations.
